results.title: Assignment P.6.
results.brief_description: An account the evolution of the Rover Company’s P.6. car - later known as the Rover 2000 - from the initial plans to the first production line models three years later. No other credits available.

results.title: Assignment India
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: India as a land of young, exciting ideas on democracy, outgrowing its ancient patterns of caste and custom. How programs in agriculture, industry and education are geared to raise the nation’s standard of living. The reasons for the present views of Indian people, their changing attitudes and their hopes for the future. The US Ambassador to India, Mr Chester Bowles, is seen talking to the Indian Prime Minister, Mr Nehru, and discussing the village development program with a young government worker; the economic race between democratic India and Communist China; the legacy of Ghandi; and concludes with three men active in Indian government and public affairs giving their views on India’s problems and reaffirming their faith in democratic methods for their solution.

results.title: Assertive team communication
results.creator_credit: Cathy Beitz, Tracy Riddiford and Our Bizniss Productions
results.brief_description: This video package is designed for a half day group training session on assertive communication within a team environment. The manual provides background notes, suggested activities and pages to copy for overhead transparencies and the kit is flexible enough to apply to any work environment.

results.title: Assertive skills training (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Chrysalis Films
results.brief_description: This program uses a series of playlets to illustrate unassertive behaviour, the benefits resulting from assertive behaviour and better communication in personal interactions. The six segments are entitled; Work, Couples, Families, Conversations, Requests, Neighbours.

results.title: Assert at work
results.brief_description: Being assertive isn’t about speaking loudly or aggressively. It isn’t about bullying or winning. It’s about standing up for your rights without violating the rights of others. It’s about striving to achieve a “Win-win” situation. In twenty-two brief episodes we are shown eleven verbal manoeuvres and how to combat them, using four key assertion skills - regaining and holding your ground, being specific, sticking to it, and fielding responses.

results.title: Assault on the Sepik
results.creator_credit: Ross Mackenzie, Nicholas Alexander and CSIRO
results.brief_description: The story of a CSIRO program in which a black weevil was introduced into New Guinea’s Sepik River in an attempt to control one of the world’s worst water weeds, Salvinia molesta. Narrated by John Stanton.

results.title: Assault on Precinct 13
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, J Kaplan and CKK Corporation
results.brief_description: In John Carpenter’s low-budget classic, the skeleton crew of a ghetto police station fights off a horde of street thugs who are seeking revenge against a locked-up prisoner. It’s a ‘Rio Bravo’ for the lawless modern age; once the siege starts, the screen appears to explode in bullets and flying glass. The action is so raw it doesn’t seem choreographed, so fast it doesn’t seem plausible.
